data.title: Countries and demonyms in French
data.meta_description: Learn the countries of the world in French with our comprehensive list of country names, demonyms and adjectives along with their translations. Get some practise in the free interactive exercise!
data.text:
A demonym (un gentilé) is a word that refers to an inhabitant of a certain country, city, place, town, region, etc. Like in English, they are written with a capital letter.

Examples:

France → un Français/une FrançaiseFrance → a French person

Grèce → un Grec/une GrecqueGreece →a Greek person

These words also act as adjectives to describe things and concepts from a certain place. French country adjectives are written with a lowercase letter.

Examples :

J’ai rencontré une Colombienne très sympathique.I met a really nice Colombian person. (demonym)

J’aime le café colombien.I like Colombian coffee. (adjective)

Alphabetical List of Countries and Demonyms in French

The table below shows all countries and their respective demonyms. Use the arrows to sort them alphabetically.
